content: In about 7 hours, at 3pm EST (UTC-5), I'm going to give a Zoom talk at the Harvard New Technologies in Mathematics seminar on our gptf tactic and the PACT method we use to train the current version. There will be a demo. Here is the abstract and Zoom link. I also think it will be recorded and put on YouTube.

Oh nice! I gave a talk there a few months ago and Yau (big shot geometer) was in the audience. I think Hales spoke there recently -- they put my talk on YT so hopefully yours and Hales' will also end up there too
The video is up on YouTube and the slides are here.

We would love to have you try out the gptf tactic. See the instructions at https://github.com/jesse-michael-han/lean-gptf . (It is fairly easy to setup. You don't have to install any special software or anything like that, besides Lean of course. The model runs in the cloud.)
